objective: Perform calculations with various types of numbers.
content: Place value, operations on fractions/decimals/integers, and the use of scientific notation.
specific_objectives: Distinguish between different sets of numbers (natural, whole, integers, rational, irrational)
Apply the correct order of operations (BODMAS/PEMDAS)
Convert between fractions, decimals, and percentages
Represent numbers in standard form (scientific notation)
Determine factors, multiples, HCF, and LCM

objective: Apply mathematical concepts to everyday business and personal finance.
content: Profit/loss, simple/compound interest, currency conversion, and sales tax.
specific_objectives: Calculate profit, loss, and percentage profit/loss
Solve problems involving discounts, sales tax, and commissions
Calculate simple and compound interest
Solve problems related to hire purchase and mortgages
Perform currency conversions using exchange rates
Interpret utility bills (electricity, water, telephone)

objective: Use set notation and Venn diagrams to represent relationships.
content: Universal sets, subsets, intersections, and unions. Solving logic problems using sets.
specific_objectives: Define and use set notation (ϵ, ⊂, ∩, ∪, u)
Represent relationships using Venn Diagrams
Find the number of elements in a set (cardinality)
Solve problems involving up to three sets

objective: Calculate perimeter, area, volume, and time.
content: Units of measurement, circles, prisms, and cylinders. Focuses on real-world applications.
specific_objectives: Convert between metric units of length, mass, and capacity
Calculate the perimeter and area of compound shapes (rectangles, triangles, circles)
Calculate the surface area and volume of prisms, cylinders, and spheres
Solve problems involving time, speed, and distance

content: Mean, median, mode, and range. Data visualization through histograms and pie charts.
specific_objectives: Calculate measures of central tendency (mean, median, mode) for grouped and ungrouped data
Determine the range and interquartile range
Construct and interpret histograms, bar charts, and pie charts
Calculate the theoretical and experimental probability of simple events
Solve problems involving independent and mutually exclusive events

objective: Manipulate algebraic expressions and solve equations.
content: Simplification, substitution, and solving linear equations and inequalities.
specific_objectives: Simplify algebraic expressions involving terms of the same base
Substitute numerical values into algebraic expressions
Solve linear equations and inequalities in one variable
Factorize expressions (common factor, grouping, difference of two squares, quadratic trinomials)
Change the subject of a formula

objective: Understand geometric properties and solve trigonometric problems.
content: Angles, theorems (Pythagoras, Circle Theorems), and trigonometric ratios (SOH CAH TOA).
specific_objectives: Explain the properties of angles and triangles
Apply Pythagoras' Theorem to solve right-angled triangle problems
Use sine, cosine, and tangent ratios in right-angled triangles
Apply Sine and Cosine rules to non-right-angled triangles
Verify and apply Circle Theorems (angles at circumference/center, tangents)
